meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: 2012 IS JUST ANOTHER YEAR

div.a: Apocalypse Not: Here's Why You Shouldn't Worry About End Times

div.div: True, we have encountered obstacles, public-health emergencies, and even mass tragedies. But the promised Armageddons—the thresholds that cannot be uncrossed, the tipping points that cannot be untipped, the existential threats to Life as We Know It—have consistently failed to materialize.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P2yDy1&via=Digg&text=Apocalypse Not: Here's Why You Shouldn't Worry About End Times

div.div: HOW WILL WE TAKE PICTURES OF OUR FOOD?

div.a: Restaurant Offers A 5% Discount To Eat Without Your Phone

div.div: Eva Restaurant in Los Angeles offers diners a 5% discount for leaving their phones with the receptionist for the entirety of the meal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PgL0Ju&via=Digg&text=Restaurant Offers A 5% Discount To Eat Without Your Phone

div.div: KNIGHT IN SHINING HELICOPTER

div.a: Prince William Rescues Schoolgirl From Sea

div.div: This girl is going to be disappointed by men for the rest of her life.
INFOGRAPHIC

div.a: Apple, Google, Microsoft, And The Battle For The Internet

div.div: A great infographic on how the conflict between Apple, Google, and Microsoft has evolved over the years.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N2l3yL&via=Digg&text=Apple, Google, Microsoft, And The Battle For The Internet

div.div: A SOCIAL NETWORK FOR PEOPLE WITH $50
"We're building a real-time social service where users who have $50 and developers who have $100 come get to tell people that they have $50 or $100, respectively."

li.div: “In this paid model, the more people that have $50 the more people can say they have $50.” — betabeat.com/2012/08/i-have-50...

div.div: BYE BYE DRUNK PICS

div.a: Deleting Your Facebook Photos Now Actually Works

div.div: It has been more than three years since Ars first started covering Facebook's inability to remove "deleted" photos from its servers, but this particular saga appears to be coming to an end.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PfEtPh&via=Digg&text=Deleting Your Facebook Photos Now Actually Works

div.div: SHOULD'VE BROUGHT HIS TALENTS TO GITMO

div.a: Gitmo Prisoners Rewarded With Kittens, Hate LeBron James

div.div: What’s fluffy, has four paws and just might be the latest tool in the war against terror? A kitten!

li.div: You know who else hates Lebron? If what he told his lawyer is to be believed, a guy at Guantanamo. washingtonpost.com/blogs/i... via @mikenizza

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PnY5QF&via=Digg&text=Gitmo Prisoners Rewarded With Kittens, Hate LeBron James

div.div: ARACHNOPHOBIA

div.a: Spider Version Of Bigfoot Emerges From Caves

div.div: Whereas Bigfoot is probably just fiction, a huge, newly discovered spider is very real.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SwlrlG&via=Digg&text=Spider Version Of Bigfoot Emerges From Caves

div.div: DATA GIF

div.a: See How Quickly Walmart Took Over America

div.div: Take a look at this animated GIF map by Excel Hero that illustrates the wildfire-like spread of Walmart stores that led to its domination of the United States.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P1gUGY&via=Digg&text=See How Quickly Walmart Took Over America

div.div: MASTERPIECE YELP

div.a: Real Actor Reads A Yelp Review Of A Strip Club

div.div: In which a real actor makes a ridiculous Yelp review even better.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NMVNay&via=Digg&text=Real Actor Reads A Yelp Review Of A Strip Club

div.div: PORPOISES JOIN THE AXIS

div.a: Nazi Bombs, Porpoises Threaten Germany's Shift To Wind Power

div.div: Porpoises and bombs left by Adolf Hitler’s forces six decades ago are adding millions of dollars to costs for wind-turbine developers in waters off Germany, delaying the nation’s shift from nuclear energy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N1msFL&via=Digg&text=Nazi Bombs, Porpoises Threaten Germany's Shift To Wind Power

div.div: GAME GENOCIDE

div.a: Arcade Fire: Police Destroy 1,000 Illegal Games

div.div: "I felt a great disturbance in the Force, as if millions of voices suddenly cried out in terror and were suddenly silenced. I fear something terrible has happened."
APPLE TV

Apple Inc.'s vision for a new device that can be used as a set-top box includes features designed to simplify accessing and viewing programming and erase the distinction between live and on-demand content, people briefed on Apple's plans said.
NEXT: STEVE BUSCEMI AS WARIO

div.a: Penelope Cruz Awkwardly Cosplays Mario In Nintendo Ad

div.div: As Nintendo pushes New Super Mario Bros 2 for the Nintendo 3DS and 3DS XL, they’re deciding that they need none other than actress Penelope Cruz to don the classic plumber outfit to make the game seem more attractive.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/On5jmY&via=Digg&text=Penelope Cruz Awkwardly Cosplays Mario In Nintendo Ad

div.div: APPEAL TO THEIR WALLETS

div.a: Why The Pussy Riot Ruling Is Bad For Russia's Economy

div.div: blogs.ft.com - via @blakehounshell

On the face of it, there would appear to be little reason why foreign investors should worry much about Russia’s Pussy Riot court case. But that is to misunderstand Russia. In fact, the case should give even the most hard-headed international business people pause for thought.

li.div: Former Russian finance minister Kudrin: "Huge damage has been done to the country’s image and attractiveness for investors."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OFpj7e&via=Digg&text=Why The Pussy Riot Ruling Is Bad For Russia's Economy

div.div: EPIC MARRIAGE PROPOSALS

New York Time tech writer and nicked-iPhone-victim David Pogue is going to get married again. His proposal was simply amazing: He made a fake movie trailer with "a thinly veiled version" of the love story between him and his girlfriend.

li.div: Damn, David @pogue has got killer nerd game! This is amazing gizmodo.com/5935516/david-pogu...

div.div: APPLE

div.a: Steve Jobs' Stolen iPad Unwittingly Used By Clown

div.div: Kenneth Khan, otherwise known as Kenny the Clown, ended up in possession of an iPad stolen from the home of deceased Apple cofounder Steve Jobs, he and police said Thursday.

li.div: no joke. clown who once ran 4 mayor ended up with an #ipad stolen from steve jobs' palo alto home. his story: mercurynews.com/business/c... #apple

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pp9f7X&via=Digg&text=Steve Jobs' Stolen iPad Unwittingly Used By Clown

div.div: CRIME DOESN'T PAY

A real-world bank job, however, isn’t a one-way ticket to luxury. As economists Barry Reilly, Neil Rickman and Robert Witt explain in a new study, “The return on an average bank robbery is, frankly, rubbish.”
LIKE ROBBING CANDY FROM TRAINED KILLERS

div.a: Burglars Attempt To Rob Mixed Martial Arts Gym

div.div: When you ask a stupid question, you get a stupid answer. And when you attempt a stupid crime, you might get your butt kicked.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q4NHJW&via=Digg&text=Burglars Attempt To Rob Mixed Martial Arts Gym
